result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R Hibben was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--no contact with Heather Antoniewicz and ERA (dob: 3/10/2006)

--no acts or threats of violence

--no possession or ingestion of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--complete certified Batterers Intervention programming

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

timeConds.notes:
--4 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/Huber privileges, to commence on  7/14/16 at 7:00 pm.

--the Court authorizes transfer to another county so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson County, that is without passive custodial status.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Case called at 8:11am [mo]
Defendant Christopher R Hibben in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; states there is a written victim impact statement, also that Ms. Antoniewicz would like to address the Court.

Statement made by Ms. Antoniewicz
DA Happ submits written victim impact statement; Court reviews
Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
ADA Monica Hall takes the place of DA Happ as State's Representative at 8:29am

The Court aknowleges review of all documents submitted by Defense
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Meyer

The Court inquires of Defense the definity of termination of Mr. Hibben's employment based upon service of a jail term/conditional jail
--Atty. Meyer indicates that it is that there is no definitive answer; therefore does not request additional time to investigate this issue

Statement made by Mr. Hibben

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 year.
The Court adopts all conditions of Probation as layed out in the Criminal Case Settlement, except jail term (addressed separately).

[which are

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Heather Antoniewicz and ERA(dob: 3/10/2006)
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete certified Batterers Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--to pay statutory costs]

As a condition of Probation, the Court orders Mr. Hibben to serve:
--4 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/Huber privileges, to commence on  7/14/16 at  7:00 pm.
--the Court authorizes transfer to another county so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson County, that is without passive custodial status.


Days credit for time already served:  3  days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition warnings given
recess: 9:45am
Sentencing hearing on June 30, 2016 at 08:10 am.
Criminal Case Settlement
with attached JI's

Case called at 9:39 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Christopher R Hibben in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Meyer submits plea paperwork, requests the Court take plea today and set over sentencing

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4 & #5
Court reminds Mr. Hibben that his bond remains in effect
Recess: 9:57 am

Case called at 1:40 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher R Hibben appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Mr. Hibben has not been evaluated as he indicated that he would be looking for his own representation, so SPD appears for bond purposes only

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
DOB & address confirmed accurate; Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No contact with Heather Antoniewicz or her child EJ
-No presence at Heather Antoniewicz's residence or any place she may be residing
Recess: 1:44 pm
